references.paper_title: Neural architecture search with reinforcement learning
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of Neural Architecture Search (NAS), introducing the concept and a reinforcement learning-based approach.
DARTS is a highly influential NAS method that uses gradient-based optimization, significantly improving the efficiency and scalability of the search process.

references.paper_title: NAS-Bench-201: Extending the scope of reproducible neural architecture search
references.reason: NAS-Bench-201 is a widely used benchmark dataset for evaluating NAS algorithms, enabling fairer comparisons and promoting reproducibility.

references.paper_title: NAS-Bench-101: Towards reproducible neural architecture search
references.reason: NAS-Bench-101 was one of the first significant attempts at creating a standardized benchmark dataset for NAS, laying the groundwork for more reproducible research.
This paper introduced the concept of zero-cost proxies, which significantly reduces the computational cost of evaluating candidate architectures during NAS.
